pr_title: Make sure SelectVariants outputs variants in correct order (assuming input vcf is correctly sorted)

timeline.message: fixing bug which allowed SelectVariants to output vcf with incorrectly sorted variants
make SelectVariants always trim alleles when perserveAlleles is false
fixing bug where --set-filtered-gt-to-nocall combined with sample selection and allele trimming causes crash

timeline.bodyText: You can make this final by moving its constructor up to the declaration.
timeline.author: davidbenjamin

timeline.bodyText: Moving variants to the right may seem like a non sequitur to the average reader so specify that it can occur if {@code preserveAlleles} is false.
timeline.author: davidbenjamin

timeline.bodyText: I would just add every variant to pendingVariants.  This check is redundant with the while loop at the beginning of apply().  It's true that written as is the priority queue is usually empty, but I don't think the optimization is worth the added complexity.
timeline.author: davidbenjamin

replies.bodyText: Yeah you're right, I was trying to avoid doing too many comparisons in the priority queue, but since it is nearly always empty this is an essentially useless optimization.
replies.author: kachulis

timeline.author: davidbenjamin
davidbenjamin

timeline.bodyText: This test needs some javadoc explaining the potential output ordering pitfall of the input untrimmed variants.
timeline.author: davidbenjamin
